content: still not sure what's happening with the nimbus-ethjs combination

author: jochembrouwer
content: Is there anything funny happening in that block? I just noticed that we might not have marked the Beacon root precompile as a warm precompile - is this part of devnet8 spec (beacon root precompile should be warm?) ( <@792822129019584562> )

author: jochembrouwer
content: I think on top of 2929 it should be warm, but I am rather sure it is not warm for us, which is weird because we pass pyspec tests?

author: g11tech
content: most likely our canonical number to block mapping for that block is messedup as the top (and rest of chain matches)

author: g11tech
content: also for lodeatar<>ethereumjs pair even that is matching, so its not state related

author: g11tech
content: lodestar<>ethereumjs was re-synced from wiped db

author: g11tech
content: i i don't think any txs using precompiles have yet been seeded , <@412614104222531604> let know if you know better

author: jochembrouwer
content: It should be a tx not directly calling into the precompile

author: jochembrouwer
content: So via a contract, otherwise the warm/cold check is not done

author: jochembrouwer
content: I am rather sure such Tx will break us

author: jochembrouwer
content: (or via create tx)

author: jochembrouwer
content: `5F5F60205F5F600B5AF1` this payload should do it

author: jochembrouwer
content: Hm nvm you need an actual timestamp so you dont consume all gas at the precompile... maybe it still breaks though not sure

author: g11tech
content:
we can send a payload and confirm which clients break alongside us and deploy the fix

but this block hash differing is separate issue, most likely with our canonical num => block mapping staying unchanged because of some edge condition, will look into it

author: jochembrouwer
content: I think you mean that our number => hash for the canonical chain is not up-to-date with the actual canonical chain right?

author: g11tech
content: for that block because there might be some forking there

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yes exactly

author: g11tech
content: we have had such issues in past though i thought i fixed it, may be some edge case still remains

author: marioevz
content: I don't think any of the pyspec tests use a default warm for the beacon root predeploy, except for the tests where we add the address and storage keys to the tx access lists, but otherwise it should always be cold (at least last time I checked the spec)

author: jochembrouwer
content: We match this spec. However, I don't think it matches the current beacon precompile spec if you also read EIP 2929, since beacon precompile is a precompile, it should technically be warm..?

author: marioevz
content: But technically it's not a precompile, it's a predeployed contract
